meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose confidence or hope.
meanings.sent1: The coach's harsh criticism demoralized the young players.
meanings.sent2: The constant failures demoralized him, but he never gave up.
meanings.sent3: The demoralization of the team led to a hilarious mix-up during the game.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected defeat demoralized them like a sudden storm on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The image of defeat lingered in his mind, a heavy cloak of demoralization.

meanings.definition: The process of undermining the morale or confidence of someone or a group.
meanings.sent1: The demoralization of the soldiers was evident after the long battle.
meanings.sent2: The demoralization of the employees was a result of constant criticism.
meanings.sent3: The demoralization of the team turned into a funny anecdote at the office party.
meanings.sent4: The demoralization of the group was like a dark cloud hanging over their heads.
meanings.sent5: The demoralization of the students was a vivid reminder of the challenges they faced.
